ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would, I think the class does a very good job teaching the foundational microeconomics material well.
Yes, especially if you have certain background in microecon and you are not pursuing a Econ Phd.
I would recommend ECON 545 for students without and an undergraduate background in Microeconomics.

I may not recommend the course to other students as it is a course in-between the undergraduate and Phd level economics courses. Much of my learning came from my own understanding of the lecture notes - which is doable without attending the lectures themselves.
Good for an in-depth exploration of some microeconomics concepts.

I would recommend the class for someone who is interested in microeconomic theory and proving them mathematically. I believe the class was not what I was expecting and was a lot more proving theories than what I was expecting.

The course is a great rigorous class on the fundamentals of micro economics. It covers many of the topics in a PhD level course, but is slightly less theoretical and mathematical (it isn't just proofs). The class is challenging, problem sets take a long time, and the tests can be difficult. Be prepared to put in a lot of time. However, Prof. Boozer is a great lecturer and is very helpful to those who feel confused or that they are falling behind.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course gave me a more solid foundation for key economic concepts on which to form my intuitions about policies and development programs.
ECON 545 deepened my knowledge of Microeconomics and taught me many new concepts. It also showed me more of the complexities underlying the discipline.
I believe I did not choose the right course; however, I hope to use some of the skills I learned in the future.
Supporting me in further researches by providing me a clear picture of how economy operates minorily.
required course for SOM OB PHD, but not at all related to my research
